08:22
oh i'm still reading
meowshka
"HIP-74 proposes to limit the five oldest Radio deployments with the highest signal strength in a given hex for reward eligibility" https://github.com/helium/HIP/blob/main/0074-mobile-poc-modeled-coverage-rewards.md#impact-on-rewards
gateholder 01/19/2023 8:22 AM
Right but look at the link https://coverage-explorer.herokuapp.com/hex/08c2ab2cd8d06bff This is showing indoors making 800 the only logic I can use to figure this out is that the main hex is blocking other outer hexes might be a glitch or something I'm missing.
meowshka 01/19/2023 8:25 AM
We're not taking into account 5 Radio limit yet when calculating points on the map, however, we do take into account signal strength level of competing Radios. We always cut off from rewards signal with Low level if there's a Radio with higher signal strength. That is what happening here.
1
meowshka
We're not taking into account 5 Radio limit yet when calculating points on the map, however, we do take into account signal strength level of competing Radios. We always cut off from rewards signal with Low level if there's a Radio with higher signal strength. That is what happening here.
gateholder 01/19/2023 8:25 AM
Ok thank you for clarification

Zbb

gateholder 01/19/2023 9:22 AM
right no doubt there are some bad setups, but plenty are above the 2500 points to maintain the existing ratio. Most seem to be between 3000 and 5000 which is a bit of an increase but yes some are quite bad
meowshka
We're not taking into account 5 Radio limit yet when calculating points on the map, however, we do take into account signal strength level of competing Radios. We always cut off from rewards signal with Low level if there's a Radio with higher signal strength. That is what happening here.
Balsteg 01/19/2023 9:23 AM
Thanks for the explanation, makes sense now. This is for both indoor and outdoor radios? And is it only for Low signal strength (Tier3 for outdoor, Tier 2 for indoor)? I don't see this documented in the Hip anywhere.
gateholder
right no doubt there are some bad setups, but plenty are above the 2500 points to maintain the existing ratio. Most seem to be between 3000 and 5000 which is a bit of an increase but yes some are quite bad

Indoor radios should be mutually exclusive to outdoor radios since indoor radios of course are attempting to cover only indoor and outdoor are attempting to cover only outdoor

Cryptonite 01/20/2023 2:13 PM
Does anyone know the reasoning as to why why indoor radios compete with outdoor radios as it relates to being rewarded? If the outdoor and indoor are meant to provide different coverage, why are the points the indoor radio receives affected by the outdoor radio? I understand when radios are in the same hex that the strongest signal is the radio that is rewarded, but I don't understand why the indoor and outdoor compete

gutentag

Cryptonite 01/20/2023 3:17 PM
But they are competing for PoC rewards when outdoor and indoor hexes overlap. Looks to me that my outdoor radios get the rewards for indoor adjecent hexes. This means all my locations only get 400 points for the indoor radio (instead of the full 1,000) because directly above it are outdoor radios. I'm just saying I don't think the rewards the indoor radios receive should be hampered because of the outdoor radios above it. It disincentivizes us installing an indoor radio at locations if there are outdoor radios above it. We'd be better off installing a standalone indoor radio at another location and not install outdoor radios above it so we can earn the full 1,000 points. Anyway, maybe this is the kind of behavior desired?
gateholder
its been this way since day one?
Cryptonite 01/20/2023 3:18 PM

Digerati 01/24/2023 4:58 PM
To earn MOBILE, you need a 5G-compatible gateway and radio, from those on this list with the MOBILE tag: https://www.helium.com/mine#hotspots
16:58
Only available in the US for the foreseeable future because the US is the only country that has passed laws allowing open/public use of the spectrum
